intro: Chamaecrista ensiformis var. maranonica, commonly known as the Maranon ticktrefoil, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly the Amazon region. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in moist, tropical environments. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow or orange flowers arranged in racemes. Its fruit is a legume pod containing several seeds, and it is part of the Fabaceae family, known for nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant is often used in traditional medicine and has ecological significance in its native habitat.
